Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label at least two different types of habitats, such as a land habitat like a garden and a water habitat like a pond.
The student can accurately illustrate and label different types of plants and animals found in each habitat, such as trees, flowers, squirrels, or fish.
The student can show and label the diversity of life by including a variety of living things in each habitat drawing.
The student can identify and represent patterns in the diversity and types of living things across the different habitats through their illustrations.
The student can organize the drawings to make clear comparisons between the amount and types of living things in different habitats.
